availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Newton Stinson (Crittenden County, Kentucky, post master.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, post master. Crittenden County, Kentucky native. Son of Andrew Miller Stinson and Catherine McAlister Stinson. Married Rebecca Dunn in Crittenden County, Kentucky on June 12, 1844. Father of Rosa A. Stinson, Charles A. Stinson, R.N. Stinson, R.D. Stinson. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucy in 1850. Merchant in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860. Post master in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 239A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion (West Half), p. 407.
Find A Grave, "David Newton Stinson (1821-1903)," Memorial #67557572, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67557572 (accessed April 20, 2019)
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film 000558428, p. 9.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion, p. 316A.
